intro: Pilosella atrocrinita, commonly known as the black-hairy cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are deeply lobed and covered in fine, white to greyish hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The small, yellow flowers appear in clusters and bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
